result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M Anderson

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:28 a.m.   Court calls case.   Appearances cited. Attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daniel W Johns Jr in court for John M Anderson.    Defendant John M Anderson in court, in custody.  Here today on defendant's motion to modify bond.  D.A. reports victim's rights have been complied with in case in general.  Defendant is requesting a signature bond.  D.A. states he would request condition of no contact with children under age 18.  D.A. is concerned about defendant's address and being a flight risk.  D.A. would ask for a small cash bond.  Court asks defendant about his living arrangement should he be released.   He states he would be living with his sister and his job at Taco Bell is still available.  Attorney Johns states his client has no cash resources for a cash bond.  Court orders $20,000 signature bond but with a $500 cash component required.  Court modifies bond conditions to also include that defendant may not use his phone or other electronic means to contact anyone under the age of 18.  Also, once per week, defendant shall physically report to the Iron County Sheriff's office sometime between the hours of 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. in order to keep track of his whereabouts.  Atty. Johns states they will work on getting the $500 cash but may need to to bring his client in for a future hearing if they are unable to do so.  Court adjourned at 10:35 a.m.  wmg
Pre-trial conference on October 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:24 AM Defendant John M Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel W Johns Jr in court for John M Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Per Atty Johns, has gone through complaint, waives formal reading.  Understands charges and penalties.  Would like to preserve right to prelim, but waives time limits.  Per DA, would like to set PTC for 10/18.  Atty Johns would also like to schedule bond modification hearing.  10/7 at 11:30 a.m.  Adj.  10:27 a.m.  klr
Adjourned initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:11 AM Defendant John M Anderson in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty John Best appears via Zoom video for def. in 22CM59.  Court refers to 22CF49.  Def indicates still waiting for appt on 22CF49.  Court questions Atty Best re representation.  Back to 22CM59.  Atty Best has gone over complaint with client and PTC held.  PLQ filed.  Atty Best states agreement.  Dismiss Count 1, plead to Count 2, $443.50.  Def understands proposal and wants to do as stated.  PLQ has been filed.  Court questions def.  Def understands agreement, etc.  No coercion to plead.  Court goes through rights def is waiving.  Def understands.  Court explains elements State would have to prove.  Def understands.  Satisfied with representation.  Atty Best, def knowingly, vol, intell plead.  Court finds so.  State moves to dismiss Count 1.  No obj.  Court grants.  Def pleads G to Count2.  Court find FB, fines def guilty.  DA addresses Court before sentencing.  Vic rts complied with.  Atty Best addresses Court prior to sentencing.  Atty Best did meet with def on 9/2 for PLQ signing.  Def does not exercise rt of allocution.  Court accepts recommendation.  Orders $443.50.  DNA sample, fingerprinted and booked.  60 DTP or make payment arrangements.  Back to 22CF49.  Def has contacted public def office but court adjourning again for def to get atty.  Court reviews prelim time limits.  Def continues to waive time limits on prelim until has counsel.  Will schedule as soon as counsel appointed.  Def unable to post bond.  AIA to be set for 10/3 at 9:00 a.m.  Adj.  9:22 a.m.  klr
re: notice of hearing for 9/19/22 adj. initial appearance
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:00 AM Defendant John M Anderson in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew J Tingstad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def indicates he does qualify for PD but has not received an appointment yet.  Court going to continue initial to 9/19/21 at 9:00 a.m.  If gets atty, can revisit bond issue.  Adj.  9:04 a.m.  klr

ANDERSON, JOHN:  TRANSFERRED TO FILE #22CF49.  10:38 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears by phone for the State of WI.  John Anderson appears in person, in custody.  Here on probable cause statement today.  Court explains meaning of PC hrg to def.  He understands.  Court explains right to atty.  Officer Geach sworn in.  Court asks officer not to mention alleged names of victims in his testimony.  Court states victim's names will be redacted on PCS.  Court reads charges to def.  Officer Geach testifies as to events.  Both victims were under 16 years of age.  Court satisfied there is sufficient PC in this matter given info given.  DA requests:  No contact with vict 1 and 2 as stated in PCS.  No contact with anyone under 18, no use of internet.  Asks for cash bond of $50,000.  Mr. Anderson responds stating he is not a flight risk and has job.  Court asks def questions.  Sheriff states there are charges in MI also.  Court sets bond at $20,000 cash with no contact with victims or children under 18 unless parents are present.  Taco Bell job ok to work at.  Court doesn't impose internet restriction at this time but cautions def's activity will probably be scrutinized.  Court asks def about waiver of prelim.  Def not sure how to answer.  Court extends time for prelim for good cause.  Def can demand one later after talking to attorney.  Court sets for initial for Aug 29 at 9:00 a.m.  If he gets atty and demands a prelim, we can take that up later.  Adj.  10:58 a.m.  Clerked by wmg/typed by klr
